sentence.text: And because I am in the public eye it is important that I fight back , that I show the world that the police are not infallible and that the rotten apples in the barrel must be exposed .
You 're sometimes so busy looking at the wood that you do n't smell the trees are rotten . "
It was n't very safe , the whole of the summer-house was rotten , but it was very quiet and private , screened by the steep pitch of the roof on either side .
As if every sentence he had ever written had not cried out to the heavens that the man had as much integrity as a rotten tree-trunk .
He had the most disgusting rotten teeth and horn rim glasses with milk bottle lenses .
From that bad start , many little rotten apples grew .
THEY call Eddie Newton ` Isaac " at Stamford Bridge , and you do n't need a rotten apple on the head to work that one out .
A few windows were flung open , and two little lads pelted Broomhead with rotten apples before they were chased off .
Teething with green , foul diarrhoea smelling of rotten eggs and there may be colicky pain and bloating .
When Vice-President Nixon toured the area in 1958 he was pelted with rotten eggs and jostled by angry demonstrators .
In London he had joined gangs who had thrown rotten tomatoes , eggs or whatever was at hand into Salvation Army meetings .
Pelted with rotten eggs and faced with armed threats , the protesters eventually turned back .
I use a mercury vapour light trap regularly to trap moths , and hanging traps baited with rotten fruit or fish offal attract specialist feeders , such as blowflies .
Pelting speakers with rotten fruit was forbidden .
The prison is packed with murderers , the gibbets are heavy like apple trees in the autumn , the branches bend with their rotten fruit . "
The smell of rotten oranges from the alley was strong as the swing-doors were pushed open .
Like many other inmates at Zomba , a prison diet of often rotten vegetables affected him : he was almost blind from cataracts in both eyes and suffered from stomach ulcers .
They have a very strong smell that has been likened to a variety of disagreeable substances , from stale sweat to rotten onions .
` We used to pelt the pigs with rotten potatoes . "
` The Frogs are dumping all their rotten Golden Delicious on us , and we 're not going to put them in our loft , are we ?
